Entries.NPC.cs.4001: When I last visited my former home by the sea, that strange fruit washed ashore at my feet... #$b#If you'll bear with me, I've composed a poem to accompany it.#$b#*ahem* 'To @, my beloved.'#$b#I traveled to this land to grow a rose, whose seed slept in the very soil of me. A perfect isolation I'd impose; I'd nurture it alone beside the sea.#$b#The seaside had the sun, and I the soil; I'd thought a rose should need no more to thrive. I never realized that, for all my toil, mere saltwater could not keep it alive.#$b#The seed lay buried and refused to grow, until you came to me amidst the gloom... #$b#Your heart a spring, from which the waterflow... poured into me, until my seedling bloomed.$l#$b#Put simply, @, I love you. I hope my gift inspires you in your work, as you've so often inspired mine.$l
